org.araneaframework.uilib.util
Class NameUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.util.NameUtil

public class NameUtil
extends Object

This class is a general helper, which is used throughout UiLib to parse Strings like events and hierarchical names. This helper mainly deals with path-like names, which may contain dots to separate names. More specifically, a full name is in form like "[zero.or.more.prefix.names.]name". A full name may have a prefix, but always has a name. Therefore, when the full name has no prefix, methods parsing the prefix return null, and methods parsing the name suffix will return the original parameter.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov@araneaframework.org)

Method Detail

getFullName

public static String getFullName(String prefix,
                                 String suffix)
This method is here to support tags which cannot use the fancier method getFullName(String...) due to being legacy code.

See Also:
getFullName(String...)

getFullName

public static String getFullName(String... names)
Constructs a full name from the given names. Each name will be concatenated by a dot while omitting empty or null name values. This method is null-safe and when names array is empty, the result will be null.

Parameters:
names - An array of names to concatenate in the order they are given.
Returns:
The constructed full name or null.

containsDot

protected static boolean containsDot(String fullName)

getShortestSuffix

public static String getShortestSuffix(String fullName)
Returns the part of fullName that follows the last dot. When the parameter contains no dots, the result will be equal to the original parameter value.

Parameters:
fullName - The full name, which may or may not contain dots.
Returns:
The part that comes after the last dot, or the original input string.

getLongestSuffix

public static String getLongestSuffix(String fullName)
Returns the part of fullName that follows the first dot. When the parameter contains no dots, the result will be equal to the original parameter value.

Parameters:
fullName - The full name, which may or may not contain dots.
Returns:
The part that comes after the last dot, or the original input string.

getShortestPrefix

public static String getShortestPrefix(String fullName)
Returns the part of fullName that precedes the first dot. When the parameter contains no dots, the result will be null.

Parameters:
fullName - The full name, which may or may not contain dots.
Returns:
The part that comes before the first dot, or null.

getLongestPrefix

public static String getLongestPrefix(String fullName)
Returns the part of fullName that precedes the last dot. When the parameter contains no dots, the result will be null.

Parameters:
fullName - The full name, which may or may not contain dots.
Returns:
The part that comes before the last dot, or null.
Since:
1.0.9

getEventName

public static String getEventName(String eventActionParam)
Returns the event name extracted from the action parameter of the "Event" action. It is the part in the action parameter before the first "$".

Parameters:
eventActionParam - the action parameter of the "Event" action
Returns:
the event name.

getEventParam

public static String getEventParam(String eventActionParam)
Returns the event parameter extracted from the action parameter of the "Event" action. It is the part in the action parameter after the first "$".

Parameters:
eventActionParam - the action parameter of the "Event" action
Returns:
the event parameter.
